description: After the evening of Fête de la Musique, nearly 145 suspected cases of 'random syringe attacks' were reported. Yet, to date, not a single case of drug injection has been confirmed.

headline: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' attorney takes aim at accusers in closing argument, defends rapper's sexual 'lifestyle'
description: Combs, 55, is a 'self-made, successful Black entrepreneur' who had romantic relationships that were 'complicated' but ultimately consensual 'love stories,' the rapper's defense attorney Marc Agnifilo said on Friday.

headline: A heat dome will settle over France for several days, with temperatures reaching up to 40°C
description: The heatwave is intensifying and spreading across France. It will peak on Monday and Tuesday, with temperatures rising to 36°C and 38°C (around 96 to 100°F) over two-thirds of the country. This heatwave bears the signature of human-induced climate change.

headline: Four Syrian weddings, a symbol of reconciliation
description: In Latakia, a Syrian coastal city that has been the site of killings targeting the Alawite minority, four Sunni and Shiite couples had a joint wedding. The celebration aimed to counter the sectarian divisions tearing the country apart, as illustrated by an attack on a church in Damascus in June.

headline: Families of Iranian detainees express fear after Israeli strike on Evin prison
description: No official toll has been released after Israeli strikes on the Tehran penitentiary, which held numerous political prisoners.

headline: Has the Mendelssohn Stradivarius, stolen by the Nazis, been found?
description: An investigation by an American academic asserts the 'Small Mendelssohn,' an exceptional violin taken from the Mendelssohn family during World War II, is the same instrument as the 'Stella,' the magnificent violin currently played by Japanese virtuoso Eijin Nimura. He denies that.
